required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of JMT101 Combined With Afatinib (or Osimertinib) in Patients With Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase Ib,Open Label,Multi-center Study to Assess the Efficacy and Safety of JMT101 Combined With Afatinib (or Osimertinib) in Patients With Locally Advanced or Metastatic Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer With EGFR Exon 20 Insertion Mutations

collaborator.agency: CSPC ZhongQi Pharmaceutical Technology Co., Ltd.

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a Phase Ib, open label, multi-center study of to evaluate the safety and efficacy of JMT101 combined with EGFR-TKIs (Afatinib or Osimertinib) in patients with locally advanced or metastatic non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) harboring EGFR exon 20 insertion mutations.

detailed_description.textblock:
The objective of the trial is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of JMT101 combined with EGFR-TKIs (afatinib or osimertinib) in patients with locally advanced or metastatic NSCLC with EGFR exon 20 insertion mutations.
This study consists of two parts (Stage I and Stage II). Stage I was a dose escalation study, and Stage II was a dose expansion study.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of adverse events (defined by the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events version 5.0 (CTCAE V5.0)).
primary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment until 30 days after the last dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Objective Response Rate (ORR) Assessed by Blinded Independent Review Committee (IRC) per RECIST Version 1.1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose to disease progression or end of study, an average of 1 year
From first dose to disease progression or end of study, an average of 1 year
From first dose to disease progression or end of study, an average of 1 year
From first dose to death or end of study, an average of 1 year

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the concentration curve from time 0 to the concentration at last time point (AUC0-last) of JMT101.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment until 30 days after the last dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum measured plasma concentration (Cmax) of JMT101.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment until 30 days after the last dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to maximum plasma concentration (Tmax) of JMT101.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment until 30 days after the last dose
From enrollment until 30 days after the last dose
From enrollment until 30 days after the last dose
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples will be collected from subjects post treatment for assessment to detect the presence of anti-drug antibodies and neutralizing antibodies.

secondary_outcome.measure: Potential biomarkers detected in plasma circulating tumor DNA.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment up to disease progression, an average of 1 year

clinical_study.condition: Locally Advanced or Metastatic Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer

arm_group.description: Two dose levels of JMT101 combined with afatinib or osimertinib will be tested according to the "3 + 3" dose-escalation design. The dose-limiting toxicity (DLT) will be assessed from the first administration to the end of the first cycle (28 days).
Once the effective dose has been determined, an expansion cohort will be opened to evaluate the efficacy and safety of the selected dose.

intervention.description: IV infusion Q2W for 4 weeks (28-day cycles)

facility.name: The Fourth Hospital of Hebei Medical University
